summary: Build a "Tyagi Chef" hospitality management app to manage job openings, candidates, interviews, and clients.
known_issues: UI error: <Select.Item /> has an empty-string value prop; Select uses empty string to clear selection and show placeholder, so items must have non-empty values.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity login and a basic role model for access control (at minimum: Admin and Staff) so authenticated users can manage job openings, candidates, interviews, and clients.
Build a React UI with navigation for Jobs, Candidates, Interviews, and Clients, each with: list view (search + filters), create form, edit form, and detail view.

Add a dashboard home screen that summarizes key counts (e.g., Open Jobs, New Candidates, Interviews Scheduled Today/This Week, Active Clients) and provides quick links to create a new Job, Candidate, Interview, and Client.

Implement consistent, creative visual theme and layout for the app (typography, spacing, components, and color palette) suitable for a professional hospitality staffing tool; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.

Add static generated brand assets and wire them into the UI (app icon/favicon + login/empty-state illustration) by placing files under frontend/public/assets/generated and referencing them directly from the frontend.

Remove all <SelectItem value="">â€¦</SelectItem> usages and replace them with a non-empty sentinel value (e.g., "__none__") for optional selects (Job Client, Candidate Linked Job, Interview Job Opening) while preserving the ability to clear the selection and show the placeholder by setting the Select value to an empty string.

Update the optional-select implementations in these pages to use the sentinel "None" option and map it to clearing the selection (empty string) in component state: frontend/src/pages/candidates/CandidateCreatePage.tsx (jobOpeningId), frontend/src/pages/candidates/CandidateEditPage.tsx (jobOpeningId), frontend/src/pages/interviews/InterviewCreatePage.tsx (jobOpeningId), frontend/src/pages/interviews/InterviewEditPage.tsx (jobOpeningId), frontend/src/pages/jobs/JobCreatePage.tsx (clientId), frontend/src/pages/jobs/JobEditPage.tsx (clientId).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create hospitality management app for Tyagi Chef to manage job openings, candidates, interviews, and clients

Create backend data models and CRUD APIs for Job Openings, including: title/role, client association (optional), location, salary/rate (optional), description/requirements, status (Open/Paused/Closed), createdAt/updatedAt.

Create backend data models and CRUD APIs for Candidates, including: full name, phone/email, skills/notes, source, status (New/Screening/Interviewing/Offered/Placed/Rejected), and optional linkage to a Job Opening they are being considered for.

Create backend data models and CRUD APIs for Interviews, including: candidate, job opening (optional if derived from candidate link), interview date/time, interview type (Phone/Video/In-person), interviewer name, location/meeting link, status (Scheduled/Completed/No-show/Cancelled), and outcome notes.
Create backend data models and CRUD APIs for Clients, including: company name, contact person, phone/email, address (optional), notes, and status (Active/Inactive).
